alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Rockdale (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 6:04PM EST until January 10 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia affecting Rockdale and DeKalb Counties. For the Yellow River Basin...including Lithonia...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Significant flooding expands into the woodlands and fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Pleasant Hill Road. In Dekalb County...some flooding of backyards of homes occurs on Harmony Hills Drive and Court. Johnson Creek flowing under Union Grove Road into the river continues to back up. In Rockdale County...some flooding of yards begins in the Lake Capri subdivision. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 PM EST Tuesday was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.5 feet on 05/07/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 615 AM EST.
